page.title: 09CHILDRENS RECREATION
page.content: Surveys by children of{Horndean and {Wecock Middle Schools}showed that watching television was the most popular activity. Riding bicycles came next, particularly bicycle motor cross riding. Other popular activities included dancing, reading and board games. Many children like belonging to clubs which provide activities like scouting and guiding, boxing, football, computing and judo. School playground games tend to be group or team games involving chasing, for example catch, bulldog, football, kinger and blue murder. Younger childrens games were more concerned woth role play. Mummies and Daddies, schools, nurses and shops are examples. During school physical education lessons preferred activities were football, rounders and athletic events like running and hurdling.
